org.gradoop.flink.model.impl.operators.layouting.functions

Class VertexFusor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradoop.flink.model.impl.operators.layouting.functions.VertexFusor

  • public class VertexFusor
extends Object
    Simplifies the graph by combining similar vertices to super-vertices using a Comparison-Function and a threshold.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  VertexFusor.CandidateGenerator
      Finds out if two given vertices could be merged into one and how "good" this merge would be.
      protected static class  VertexFusor.SuperVertexGenerator
      Combines multiple vertices into a single super-vertex.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected VertexCompareFunction compareFunction
      The VertexCompareFunction to use to find similar vertices
      protected double threshold
      Only consider vertices as similar if their similarity is larger then this value

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public LGraph execute(LGraph graph)
        Execute the operation. Should be called iteratively. A single call is usually not enough for practical results.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph to simplify
        Returns:
        A tuple containing the vertices and edges of the simplified graph

      • chooseDonorsAndAcceptors

        protected org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<org.apache.flink.api.java.tuple.Tuple2<LVertex,Boolean>> chooseDonorsAndAcceptors(org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<LVertex> vertices)
        Splits the vertices randomly into donor and acceptor-vertices (~50/50).
        Parameters:
        vertices - vertices to classify
        Returns:
        Tuple2<LVertex, Boolean>. If the boolean is true, the vertex is an acceptor

      • generateFusionCandidates

        protected org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<org.apache.flink.api.java.tuple.Tuple2<LVertex,LVertex>> generateFusionCandidates(org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<org.apache.flink.api.java.tuple.Tuple2<LVertex,Boolean>> classifiedVertices,
                                                                                                                              org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<LEdge> edges)
        Finds connected vertices by joining with the edges. Finds out if the two vertices should be merged together and if so outputs a tuple for each merge.
        Parameters:
        classifiedVertices - The vertices (split into donors and acceptors)
        edges - The edges
        Returns:
        Tuple2<LVertex, LVertex> for each merge. f0 is the donor and f1 the acceptor for the merge.

      • findRemainingVertices

        protected org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<LVertex> findRemainingVertices(org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<org.apache.flink.api.java.tuple.Tuple2<LVertex,LVertex>> fusions,
                                                                           org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<LVertex> vertices,
                                                                           org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<LVertex> superVertices)
        There are some vertices that have neither become super-vertices nor have been merged with a super vertex. Find them so they can be copied to the simplified graph.
        Parameters:
        fusions - The merges that are to be performed in this iteration
        vertices - The original vertices of the input graph
        superVertices - The newly created super-vertices
        Returns:
        All vertices that have to be copied to the output-graph

      • fixEdgeReferences

        protected org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<LEdge> fixEdgeReferences(org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<LEdge> edges,
                                                                     org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<org.apache.flink.api.java.tuple.Tuple2<LVertex,LVertex>> fusions)
        When combining two vertices into one the edges of the old vertices have to be modified to point to the new vertex.
        Parameters:
        edges - The edges of the input-graph
        fusions - The merges performed in the current iteration
        Returns:
        The "fixed" edges for the output-graph
